Package org.birchframework.framework.metric

Class RateGauge

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.birchframework.framework.metric.RateGauge
  • public class RateGauge
extends Object
    Rate calculating gauge. Registers a Gauge given the configurable parameters of the builder. At the very least, the following configurations are needed:
    • RateGaugeBuilder#name(String)
    • RateGaugeBuilder#register()
    Call the RateGaugeBuilder#register() method to obtain an immutable instance. The instance internally builds and delegates to a Gauge. Must call the increment() method in order to update the internal counter of the gauge. During each sampling, number of internal counter increments per second is calculated and reported to the MeterRegistry. In order to override this default calculation, provide a BiFunction using RateGaugeBuilder#valueFunction(BiFunction). For example: 

     final var rateGauge = RateGauge.builder()
                                .name("my.app.metric")
                                .valueFunction((count, time) -> count / (time / 1000D))   // Calculate rate as count per second
                                .register();
    The increment() method updates the internal atomic counter, asynchronously in order to minimize performance degradation at the caller.
    Author:
    Keivan Khalichi
